com.yantra.api.ycp.task

Interface registerTaskInProgress

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    YIFApi, com.yantra.api.YSCApi
    Deprecated. 
    as of 9.2.

    public interface registerTaskInProgress

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document registerTaskInProgress(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      Deprecated. 
      The registerTaskInProgress registers the task in InProgress status.

    • Method Detail

      • registerTaskInProgress

        org.w3c.dom.Document registerTaskInProgress(YFSEnvironment env,
                                            org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                     throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                            java.rmi.RemoteException
        Deprecated. 
        The registerTaskInProgress registers the task in InProgress status. A task can have up to two phases of execution. In the context of WMS, the first phase is typically picking, and the second phase is deposit. Only when all the quantity in a task has moved to the first phase can the second phase start. So, deposit can start only when picking is complete. Once the first phase is complete, the task status moves to InProgress. To indicate that first phase is complete, use the registerTaskInProgress API. Each activity group has different validations for this API.

        PUTAWAY:
        Only Open(1100) or Suggested(1200) tasks can be passed to this API.

        Exception handling: Exceptions codes of type 'SKIP' or 'PICK' can only be passed.
        • SKIP Exception handling: Skips the task suggested to the user. All the tasks from the current location gets skipped and next tasks gets suggested from the next location in sequence. (Refer getNextTask API). Depending upon the exception code configuration:
          1. Unassign user: Task is unassigned and moved to status Open (1100).
          2. Else: Task remains assigned to the user but is moved to Open status.
        • PICK Exception handling: While picking the task, user can pass exception code of type PICK. Depending on the configuration:
          1. Loose picking: The picked quantity can be less then the suggested quantity. In this scenario, new task is created with the remaining quantity to be picked. The original task is moved to InProgress status(1300) with the task quantity updated to picked quantity. The new task moves to Held status(Hold Task='Y' and status = 1400) if exception code passed is configured to hold the task. Else alternate pick location maybe suggested for the task depending on the exception code configuration. If no alternate location could be suggested the new task created is move to Held status.
          2. Case/Pallet picking: In case of Case/Pallet picking, the task is always moved to Held status.
            3. If the picked quantity is less then that suggested quantity, a new task is created with the remaining quantity to be picked. The original task is moved to progress status with the task quantity updated to picked quantity. The picked quantity can also be substituted by a single SKU LPN having quantity less than or equal to the task quantity.

        Splitting of original task: Splitting of the task in case of picking less than suggested quantity is same as in the above case (loose picking) except that no exception code setup is checked. The new task always goes to Open status.

        Pick onto equipment: User can pick the inventory onto an equipment. In this case, the original task is deallocated, allocation is made for moving the picked quantity onto the equipment and the inventory is moved to the equipment.

        Serial Handling: User has to scan as many serials as the quantity picked if the item is serialized and serial no. is required. If the number of serial no's scanned is less than the suggested quantity, the task is split for the remaining quantity as mentioned         above.

        Error Codes:
        WMS00009: Serial Quantity mismatch. This means that the picked quantity and the number of serials do not match.
        WMS00177: The exception code passed is incorrect for the current operation.

        RETRIEVAL:
        Only Open(1100) or Suggested(1200) tasks can be passed to this API.

        Mandatory Parameters: If the Task Type configuration is to pick into inventory container, than while picking the container no. has to be passed.

        Exception handling: Same as for PUTAWAY (Exception Handling).

        Inventory override: The user can substitute
        1. The suggested SINGLE SKU Case/Pallet with another SINGLE SKU Case/Pallet provided the substituted Case/Pallet has same inventory and the quantity is less than or equal to the original quantity. The original task is split if the quantity picked is less than the task quantity (See split task above).
        2. The loose SKU with SINGLE SKU Case/Pallet provided the substituted Case/Pallet has same inventory and the quantity is less than or equal to the original quantity. The original task is split if the quantity picked is less than the task quantity (See split task above).

        Pick in to inventory Case/Pallet:
      • The picked inventory is moved into the Case/Pallet. The Case/Pallet is moved into the equipment location if equipment is used. Else it is moved into the source location from which the pick is being made. If the Case or Pallet does not exist, it is created in the equipment location (if equipment is used) or the source location.

        • Pick onto equipment: Same as         Above.

        Serial Handling: User has to scan as many serials as the quantity picked if the item is serialized and serial no. is required. If the number of serial no's scanned is less than the suggested quantity, the task is split for the remaining quantity as mentioned above.

        Error Codes:
        WMS00009: Serial Quantity mismatch. This means that the picked quantity and the number of serials do not match.
        WMS00063: Mandatory parameters not passed. If the task type is to pick into container (Case/Pallet) then Case or Pallet should be passed.
        WMS00162: Container type Mismatch. This means that the type of container indicated by the Task Type and the container picked does not match.
        WMS00177: The exception code passed is incorrect for the current operation.

        OUTBOUND PICKING:
        registerTaskInProgress moves the picked task into InProgress status. The inventory changes done in different scenarios are as follows.
        • Pick into inventory container is Case/Pallet and/or Pick into outbound container is Case/Pallet:
          • The picked inventory is moved into the Case/Pallet. The Case/Pallet is moved into the equipment location if equipment is used. Else it is moved into the source location from which the pick is being made. If the Case or Pallet does not exist, it is created in the equipment location (if equipment is used) or the source location.
          • If the pick is into an outbound container, addToContainer is called for the picked quantity.
          • If the pick is into inventory container and no content is required for the Shipment, Shipment tag serial update is done for the picked quantity.
        • Pick into inventory container is blanks and Pick into outbound container is blanks (loose inventory pick):
          • If no content is required for the Shipment, Shipment tag serial update is done for the picked quantity, the picked quantity is moved into Shipping Bin.
          • If content is required, the picked quantity is moved into equipment (if equipment is used) or just the allocation is made with the picked quantity. During deposit, this allocation will get removed from the source location.If no SCM is required, the target location determined will be lane location or Dock location or out staging location of the last picked location in that order. If SCM is required, the location associated with the activity ADDTOCONTAINER is suggested first followed by lane/dock/outstaging location of last picked location. The target location determination is done runtime by prepareForDeposit API. Please read documentation for prepareForDeposit API for further details.

        Pick Exception Handling:
        If the picked quantity is less then that suggested quantity, a new task is created with the remaining quantity to be picked. The original task is moved to InProgress status with the task quantity updated to picked quantity. The suggested SINGLE SKU Case/Pallet or loose quantity can be substituted with another SINGLE SKU Case/Pallet provided the substituted Case/Pallet has same inventory and the quantity is less than or equal to the original quantity. The original task is split if the quantity picked is less than the task quantity (See split task above).

        Serial Handling: User has to scan as many serials as the quantity picked if the item is serialized and serial no. is required. If the number of serial no's scanned is less than the suggested quantity, the task is split for the remaining quantity as mentioned above.

        Error Codes:
        WMS00009: Serial Quantity mismatch. This means that the picked quantity and the number of serials do not match.
        WMS00063: Mandatory parameters not passed. If the task type is pick into container, the container SCM should should be passed.
        WMS00162: Container type Mismatch. This means that the type of container indicated by the Task Type and the container picked does not match.
        WMS00163: Container SCM mismatch. This error is thrown if Pre-pick containerization is done and the scanned SCM is not equal to the SCM of the Pre-Pick container.
        WMS00164: Container SCM already exists. This error is thrown when container scm for container no in task is void and some other container exists with the passed scm.
        WMS00177: The exception code passed is incorrect for the current operation.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: This user exit is called before executing any business logic. If input xml needs to be changed for any reason or any processing has to be done before executing the API, this can be done by this user exit. com.yantra.ycp.japi.ue.YCPBeforeTaskInProgressUE

        Events Raised:

          This event is raised upon successful execution of this api.
          IN_PROGRESS_TASK/TASK_IN_PROGRESS
            :This event is raised when task is registered in Inprogress status.
            Data published - event xml
            Key data - task_dbd.txt

          Template Support: Yes

          Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: No

        Audits:
        An Audit is performed in YFS_TASK_STATUS_AUDIT for task status.

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions:
        None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: No

Parameters:
env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.
Returns:
An XML document having latest task details and the audit details made to the task status on the platform. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
Throws:
RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
java.rmi.RemoteException
